name: Holiday Inn Express Aberdeen City Centre

reviews.text: I booked a group of 15 Speyside whisky trail travellers to stay at this hotel. My original choice was influenced by the hotel's central location as well as the fact that I hold a platinum membership in Priorityclub. As we booked many months in advance, I was also pleased by the fact that I could negotiate a reasonable rate for us all.
reviews.title: Good location, service attitude could use some adjustment

reviews.text: The hotel's location was indeed quite ideal. The rooms were standard Express by Holiday Inn quality, nothing more - nothing less. (No king-size beds available for couples, limited choice in general).I was initially given a key to my room, but it did not work when I tried it. As all others from my group stayed one floor lower, I had the idea of trying 202 instead of 302 - and yes, the number had just been written wrong on the card.
reviews.title: Really clean

reviews.text: The whole stay went ok for our group, but I felt the hotel could try and prep up a bit in their service attitude. My platinum membership was not recognized even just verbally, nor did I get any of the standard little perks which I have received at other Holiday Inn / Express by Holiday inn hotels (free drink, a warm verbal recognition). Similarly I did not get a late checkout - standard stuff for Platinum members. No one in our group got late checkout in fact.
reviews.title: Terrible Beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I pointed out to the non-recognition of the platinum membership, and was told coldly that "we do not recognize it here in any way". Ahem - well, then I guess the business isn't needed, and I won't book any more of the bi-anuual tours to stay at this hotel, thank you. So much for brand loyalty. Was very surprised to see in the lobby the priorityclub awards that this hotel had received for service. What service?
reviews.title: is a decent hotel although the breakfast was very disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the price I paid for the room I thought it was good value, spacious room and a bathroom that looks brand new.
reviews.title: Good Hotel Poor Room Servicing

reviews.text: Popped up to Aberdeen for a night out with some old friends. Booked on-line the day before for the regular price of such accommodation. Location is ideal being just off Union St. The room was very clean and perfectly comfortable, friendy welcome and very quick check-in.
reviews.title: Ideal for a night out in Aberdeen

reviews.text: I stayed here recently. It provides good basic accomodation in the heart of Aberdeen. Location is it's key selling point as it is within easy walking distance of most of Aberdeen City centre and a short taxi ride from many oil companies.
reviews.title: Conveniently located but expensive

reviews.text: The hotel is clean and reasonably comfortable - no real frills. As with many Aberdeen hotels it is rather overpriced unless you can secure a special offer rate.
reviews.title: Friendly, helpful service that goes that extra mile and great value - pet-friendly too!

reviews.text: We had to make a one-night stay in Aberdeen for a gig, and because no dog sitter was available, had to take our dogs. We made this booking online and got an excellent deal - £55 for our room, including breakfast for us two. And the hotel were happy to have our well-behaved and house-trained dogs too. Although we weren't at the hotel very long, we were most impressed with the friendly service which was most helpful - and when I left a portable keyboard in the room and telephoned them after we'd left to tell them this, a member of staff went straight up to our room to check, called me back and then posted on the keyboard by recorded delivery. Service above and beyond, methinks! Also a really great breakfast - buffet style but with some hot food too. Would certainly recommend this hotel - and it's right in the middle of Aberdeen too.
reviews.title: Surprising little find in Aberdeen

reviews.text: Spent a very comfortable night in this hotel last week. Had to write a review as I was expecting my stay to be below average and not looking forward to it. Was met by friendly staff who were happy to chat and advise on restaurants etc. Have a real thing about the importance of the staff and their ability to hold a conversation with guests. Room was everything you need on a short business trip so dont be put off with using cheaper national chains as I have in the past. Lesson learned by me I must say.
reviews.title: central - clean and efficient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: having been to the hoilday inn in Glasgow should have learned our lesson to ask for a room at the back once again the street was so noisy did not get much sleep the 2 nights we where there. there is a bakers across the road which is opened all night selling food even with the windows shut you could still hear them how come the holiday inn can't invest in better windows i don't know .
reviews.title: good rooms noisy street

reviews.text: the hotel itself is fine nice clean rooms pleasent staff good location breakfast was fine
reviews.title: I would recommend for a business visit

reviews.text: hot section a bit limited only tried the bacon a bit under done for my taste never tried the eggs because i don't like eggs the cold choice was ok for me hubby had the cooked breakfast on the first day the second day there was a big queue he said it was not worth standing in a queue for rubber eggs and under cooked bacon so he had the cold breakfast which he liked very much .
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: we got our car into the car park but as they have only a few spaces we where lucky you have to get there early we arrived about 12.00 check in is around 14.00 but they let us have a room right away thank you very much for that all in all we had a good time in Aberdeen visted some nice places Provost Skeans house and the maritime museum
reviews.title: Excellent 3* Hotel in the City Centre!

reviews.text: shopping is good for us girls for the boys plenty of bars and for both a good choice of food as well.
reviews.title: Excellent first time experience

reviews.text: Arranged a trip for a group of whisky tourists to the Highlands and Speyside, last night in Aberdeen we stayed at this very conveniently located hotel (as year before also).
reviews.title: A good experience

reviews.text: As I booked early by contacting the hotel directly and explaining how many rooms etc., we got what I'd consider a very, very reasonable rate indeed.
reviews.title: Clean, central, poor breakfast. Expensive for what you get.

reviews.text: The rooms represent your typical Holiday Inn Express quality - meaning they are very functionable, and quite modern. No complaints regarding the service of the staff this time, in fact they were very kind and went beyond any call of duty in assisting us: Most of the group members had a very early departure from Aberdeen and would have missed the breakfast due to this, but the hotel catered the breakfast an hour early for us in the downstairs restaurant. That was truly kind & appreciated.
reviews.title: Perfect base for Aberdeen centre, can be noisy though.

reviews.text: I am glad I decided to use the services of this hotel once more, they came through with flying colours. Thank you, hope to bring more visitors again next time.
reviews.title: CHEAP /CLEAN AND GREAT
room location paramount
reviews.text: Was staying here for work and chose it mainly on the basis of the central location. They have very few free car spaces and the nearby multi storey no longer allows overnight parking which is an issue.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Typical "hix" in someways but comes with great breakfast,nice bar handy for night cap!The location is good ie.Just off Union street,we had a good deal at the Abercrombie bar nearby for meals and drinks,their was a "chippy" and "la tasca" within 5 minutes walk,or 10-15 mins. walk all Aberdeens shops,sights etc.We arrived by rail and it took 15 mins. to walk to the hotel.
reviews.title: good

reviews.text: I usually prefer small. personall run hotels and B&B, but for a short trip to Aberdeen, the price and location tempted me to try this chain hotel and I was very pleasantly surprised. The room was a decent size, very clean and with everything you would need for a short stay. The complementary breakfast was a nice extra - nothing fancy but a fair range of options. The fire alarm went off in the middle of breakfast one morning, not much fun standing around an Aberdeen street on a December morning without a coat but that was the fault of a guest ignoring the rewuest to close the bathroom door when showering, as excessive steam can trigger the smoke alarm. All in all to be recommended
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well done to all...my wife and I had a great night on saturday night 14th Jan....room was spotless...we had a smoking room and although you could smell the smoke down the corridor( not really bad), it was worth it to not have to go outside for a puff....there are about a dozen spaces for car parking and we were lucky enough to get one but the multi storey 50 yards away is ok considering your in the heart of the city (max £14 overnight)...well placed for everything and the breakfast was great...all you can eat and its good...a perfect night and we WILL be back.
reviews.title: Saturday overnight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: thanks to all the staff
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on the 31 december 2011. Great value for money!
reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin

reviews.text: For wheelchair - very good but extra mattress required to raise bed
reviews.title: Wheelchair user

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bathroom - very good, walk-in shower
reviews.title: OK City Centre Hotel

reviews.text: Size of room - very good
reviews.title: DECENT CITY CENTRE HOTEL

reviews.text: Breakfast - excellent
reviews.title: Noise from customers at the all night bakery unbearable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Facilities - very good
reviews.title: Central, clean and friendly.

reviews.text: The room was clean and the normal tea and coffee facilities as expected. We were looking for a central hotel to stay in the city for one night, we got back to the hotel at midnight but there was ALOT of noise until past 3am. There are a few clubs accross the road. I would certainly not recommend this hotel on a weekend. I was aware the hotel had a tiny car park and didnt expect to get a space--we didnt. We parked in the multi storey at the top of the road, I was under the impression the fee would be 5 pounds for 12 hours, this is incorrect. The charge is 1 pound per hour until 10pm then no fee between 10pm and 8am, thereafter its 1 pound per hour, meant it was more expensive than we were expecting so had to keep running back to the car to top up the parking ticket. The toilet also didnt flush easily, not sure if there was just an issue with that particular one but that was a bit annoying. Breakfast was ok, a fair choice of buffet style foods, they had an issue with burnt toast so turned the toaster off, which is our usual breakfast but we were able to choose something else. Staff were really helpful and friendly and could not fault the service.
reviews.title: Very noisy on a Friday night

reviews.text: Saturday night accommodation in Aberdeen for a theatre break and christmas shopping? This hotel was well worth the money. Staff were attentive and rooms were great. Only tiny downfall was the noise from the party revellers(2.00am) and the street cleaner (8.00am) however being on the fourth floor it was not to bad.
reviews.title: Well worth the money

reviews.text: Very clean hotel ideal for those on a budget. I had requested a non-smoking room however despite checking in early was told no non-smoking rooms were available so was disappointed to get a smoking room despite being a non smoker and the smell of smoke was obvious throughout my 2 night stay (especially at night for some reason especially in the bathroom from the ventilation system!). Even clothes I never wore smelt of smoke on return. Cheap and cheerful furniture ; very comfortable bed. Very small kettle in room with limited choice of coffee and tea. Breakfast was choice of fruit/yoghurts/pastries/cheese/caereals etc plus sausage/scrambled eggs and baked beans. (Scrambled eggs were tasteless and sausage overcooked and rubbery). Breakfast waitress with attitude in attendance. One saving grace was that domestic staff do take great care in their work to the extent if you look under your bed you'll see a card from your domestic thanking you for looking there and trusting that the cleanliness under the bed was reflected in the room - it was! Limited number of parking spaces in a very tight car park on a first come first served basis. I don't anticipate returning.
reviews.title: Clean hotel but surprisingly disappointing..

reviews.text: Why i choose this hotel in Aberdeen... they have clean smoking room.And close to the main street.
reviews.title: Good Business hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast could be much better, but typical for this country.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel, very limited parking, get there early!, clean good location, recommended.
reviews.title: Good quality, super location

reviews.text: I did book late but this price is ridiculous - and the (complimentary - what does that mean?) breakfast was awful - they did nothing to make the £149 justified. Gordon
reviews.title: £149 and they charge for the internet

reviews.text: I have stay in this hotel on a number of occasions when my company has booked it for me. If you are given a room at the front of the hotel it will overlook the all night bakery shop on the opposite side of the road. This attracts drunks and stop-outs all night long. On the last occasion I put up with loud drunken singing several fights and loud conversations which pervented me from sleeping at all.
reviews.title: Don't stay here if you want to sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I gave up at 5:00am, got up, checked out and went to the station to await the first train south.
reviews.title: worst night sleep ever

reviews.text: My friend had his car there and use the hotel car park. He found it almost impossible to get his car back out due to the very restricted access.
reviews.title: Handy for town centre

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights with kids in a family room for £55 including breakfast. Staff were friendly, location is very central and place was spotlessly clean. Not much in the way of parking at the hotel but there is a big multi-storey just up the road which is not expensive.
reviews.title: Can't fault it - excellent value and location

reviews.text: We always stay here when we visit Aberdeen as its great value for families and a great location. The rooms are spacious and the staff friendly. This time we even had hot food for breakfast which was a bonus. I do agree with another reviewer though who mentioned the slow service as the breakfast bar was slow in being replenished and our room was not cleaned until after 5pm one day. These are just small blips though when you consider we were a family of 4 in a room for 49 gbp per night. Hotels like the HIEX make holidays all the more affordable and accessible for us.
reviews.title: Great value and location. Slow service

reviews.text: My second time staying at this hotel, and would go back again. It is under 10 minutes walk from the train station up Union Street and is surrounded by restaurants, shops and a taxi rank. Cash machine just around the corner and a mini supermarket in the next block.
reviews.title: Handy central location

reviews.text: My room was spacious and clean, complete with hairdryer, tea/coffee and plenty of towels. The window also opened to allow fresh air into the room. Shower was strong and warm. The TV showed the terrestial channels plus Sky 1 and Sky News. Check in staff were pleasant enough and I never had any need to consult them during my trip. Check out took literally one minute.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but parking is a health and safety issue.

reviews.text: Breakfast is served 6.30-9.30 during the week and is a self-service buffet style.
reviews.title: A nice stay but nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A hotel that is up to the usual Holiday Inn Group standard in terms of facilities with nice en-suite facility including a great shower, however, the street noise let it down somewhat as we were based in the front of the hotel. I had almost no sleep largely due to noise from the groups outside as there's a lapdancing bar and an all night bakery open directly across the road so it had a bit of a 'stag night' feel to it as an area, which was quite intimidating when getting back to the hotel at night.
reviews.title: Nice enough hotel, but don't expect to sleep!

reviews.text: Picked this hotel in Chapel Street due to it's proximity to the city centre and the hotel car park. Travelled with my husband and 4yr old son.
reviews.title: Fine for a night!

reviews.text: On arrival we found the car park to have spaces, however there are probably only around 8 and they are very small, so not ideal if you have a large or wide vehicle.
reviews.title: fine.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were booked into a 'family' room, but I suspect that all the rooms are classed as this, as the extra bed was a sofa bed. The room was small, but had all the facilities we required for 1 night, however wouldn't be keen on spending an extended period there when staying with a child. The bed was soft, which resulted in a grumpy husband in the morning. The rooms was very clean except the carpet which was pretty disgusting.
reviews.title: Couldn't Fault It

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good breakfast option, which was included in the price. Large continental selection with a smaller hot option.
reviews.title: Ideal for shoppers and diners

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel a lot during times of trade shows in Aberdeen, and frankly the price is way too high and the value way too low.
reviews.title: used to be a decent deal...now not so much

reviews.text: It used to be a good value, but when you start asking nearly £150 to nearly £200 for rooms in trade show weeks, its simply not in that league.
reviews.title: card payment

reviews.text: The hotel is typical Express by Holiday Inn..and that does have its merits...clean, simple rooms...decent breakfast and convenient location. However, I have noticed that the beds are frankly shot. I spent a week here and never got a decent sleep, and I have been there often enough to know to get a room at the back beyond the noise of the drunks who frequent the street under the rooms of those in front. And, get with the times and offer free wi-fi.
reviews.title: Couldn't have been more helpful.

reviews.text: The staff are great. But a friendly attitude does not overcome ridiculous prices. And, don't use the supply and demand argument. I realize Aberdeen is tight in trade show season, but not that tight anymore...
reviews.title: Hotel ok but opposite a bakery!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was on business for one night, my partner booked me a room with her bank card but when i arrived they would not authorise the payment cause she was not present. So now they want me to get in touch with her to verify for security. I have not taken my cards and only had £30 cash for food, now i phone her at her work and she speaks to reception and gives card details , but oh no they now tell me they want her to email them but she has no computer at her work and did not finish till bout 9pm, what a damn waste of a phone call. What annoys me is this is all meant to be for security safety so why is some girl behind a desk getting her to give her bank details and still not authorise the payment. If you were never going to let the payment go through without some kind of email that is all that had to be said, no phone calls or private details given out for a second time myself knowing no email would be sent that day. So now i have cancelled the room before 4pm because if i didnt holiday inn would have authorised payment for themselves, what a joke so much for security. I had to drive 130 miles back south later that night, i have stayed there six times and dont know if i should return cause i am very annoyed.
reviews.title: Immaculate rooms but poor breakfast

reviews.text: First the good stuff. The hotel is convenient for shopping, dining and generally going out. It is spotlessly clean and the staff are inconspicuously efficient.
reviews.title: Could do better.
Not enough parking and far too noisy
reviews.text: That, I'm afraid is about it. On checking in my first impression was the overwhelming stink of stale tobacco in the corridors. Not the best welcome in the world. When I opened the door of the room I was hit with a wall of heat. It was like an oven. I was able to open the window but only a crack and the wind kept blowing it shut. A noise that serenaded my first night's broken sleep. It was impossible to turn the heat in the room off so I was forced to make do with turning it down. Lack of wind meant that for the next two nights I was able to share the nocturnal chatter of the local populous.
Pillows. What is the joke with the pillows? There were two labelled, "soft" and "firm" . They were EXACTLY the same, hard as rocks.
reviews.title: Good location, lovely staff but a bit noisy for light sleepers

reviews.text: There was no electric socket near the bed so the mobile had to sit on the other side of the room to be charged which meant getting out of bed to turn off my alarm. ( Stuffy room = lack of sleep = grumpy woman )
reviews.title: It's ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are better places to stay in Aberdeen and I will be staying in one of them in future.
reviews.title: Good hotel, Good location

aka: Holiday Inn Express Aberdeen City Centre Hotel
description: The Holiday Inn Express Aberdeen City Centre Hotel is situated in the West End of Aberdeen City Centre within easy walking distance of all the City Centre attractions. The hotel is only a stone's throw from Union Street and is ideally situated for your business or leisure stay. Holiday Inn Express is the common sense choice for the value-conscious traveller. All of our bedrooms boast a power shower, direct dial telephone and satellite TV channels. There's a bar in the hotel and many restaurants and pubs close by including the stylish new Albyn Restaurant & Bar just 5 minutes away. The Holiday Inn Express Aberdeen City Centre Hotel is the perfect base to explore Royal Deeside, The Whisky Trail, the many Castles or some of the North East's Championship Golf Courses. If you are travelling to Aberdeen on business, the Holiday Inn Express Hotel is located close to many large companies such as Shell, Exxon Mobil and BP. At the Holiday Inn Express Aberdeen City Centre Hotel we also have 2 superb air-conditioned meeting rooms with natural daylight which can accommodate up to 40 delegates theatre style.
